Add/Replace/Delete.Description: The ADD/Delete/Replace modifiers are used in a definition to Add/Delete/Replace an attribute to the Definition.
Add/Replace/Delete.Name: Add/Replace/Delete

Background.Description: Specifies the Background color of the Form.
Background.Name: Background

Balance.Description: The attribute inserts the total line in the form depending upon the type of balancing method set for the form, i.e. Daily, Weekly or Yearly.

Meta.Aliases: Balance, Balancing, Closing Bal, Closing Balance

Balance.Name: Balance

Belongs To.Description: This attribute works along with Full Object. Set Belongs To and Full Object to Yes to export the dependencies associated with the object(s) being exported. By default its value is No.
Belongs To.Name: Belongs To

Bottom Button.Description: Lists the button names that appear bottom of the right vertical side of the Screen.
Bottom Button.Name: Bottom Button

Bottom Part.Description: Lists the part names appearing at the bottom of the Screen.

Meta.Aliases: Bottom Part, Bottom Parts, Right Part, Right Parts

Bottom Part.Name: Bottom Part

Bottom ToolBar Button.Description: List the button names that appear at the bottom of the form [Bottom Toolbar].

Meta.Aliases: Bottom ToolBar Button, Bottom ToolBar Buttons

Bottom ToolBar Button.Name: Bottom ToolBar Button

Button.Description: Lists the button/key names appearing when the form is triggered.

Meta.Aliases: Button, Buttons, Top Button, Top Buttons

Button.Name: Button

Cell Write.Description: Specifies whether the data should be written to the excel sheet cell by cell or as a whole.
Cell Write.Name: Cell Write

Confirm Text.Description: Specify the title to be displayed for Confirm Query on Form Accept
Confirm Text.Name: Confirm Text

Control.Description: Applies Control at the form level based on the the specified condition with a prompt / message given as the first parameter.The save for the form fails if the condition evaluates to false.
Control.Name: Control

Control Ex.Description: Applies Control Ex at the form level based on the the specified condition which prompts the extended query box.
Control Ex.Name: Control Ex

Default.Description: This attribute is used to specify the cursor focus in the report based on the logical condition. Absence of this condition always sets the cursor focus to the first line (non-fixed).
Default.Name: Default

Default Field.Description: Defaults the field with the value in the Default Value attribute value if the specified condition is true.
Default Field.Name: Default Field

Default Value.Description: This attribute sets the Default Value for the field set with the Default Field Attribute in the Form which do not have a value set with the attribute Set as. The benefit thus achieved is that when the cursor focus goes to that filed, it stays in the last position of the default string. For e.g, default value of Ch. No.: in narration field.
Default Value.Name: Default Value

DMPMode.Description: This is available in Form, Part, Line, Field and it is used only in dot matrix mode of printing to set the style.
DMPMode.Name: DMPMode

Empty.Description: This attribute is used to make the 'Form' empty based on some condition in multi printing.
Empty.Name: Empty

Excel AutoFit.Description: Used for Excel Export, and specifies if the AutoFit property of excel should be enabled or not.
Excel AutoFit.Name: Excel AutoFit

Excel No Format.Description: This attribute when used in the form does not allow changes to format during export.
Excel No Format.Name: Excel No Format

Excel Sheet Name.Description: Used for Excel Export, and gives the name for the sheet in the exported Workbook.
Excel Sheet Name.Name: Excel Sheet Name

Export.Description: This is used to pass the field value to the parent report from the current (trigger) report once the current report's form is accepted. This is useful to get the input from the user and pass it to the caller's report.
Export.Name: Export

Fetch Object.Description: This attribute is used when multiple forms are available at a report and for each form the methods pertaining to different objects are to be fetched.
Fetch Object.Name: Fetch Object

Full Height.Description: Sets the hieght of the form to 100 % of the screen if the value is Yes.
Full Height.Name: Full Height

Full Object.Description: This attribute exports the object storages associated with the Report, including UDFs when its value is yes. The default value is No.
Full Object.Name: Full Object

Full Width.Description: Sets the width of the form to 100 % of the screen if the value is Yes.
Full Width.Name: Full Width

Gray Back.Description: This attribute helps the user to control whether the screen should be greyed-out before showing the query box or not.?The default value for this attribute is FALSE.
Gray Back.Name: Gray Back

Height.Description: Sets the height of the form to the value specified.It can be specified in any unit of measurement supported by tally eg mms,inch,or % of screen/page.
Height.Name: Height

Help.Description: Specifies the index / id of the help file.
Help.Name: Help

Horizontal Align.Description: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the form on screen. The alignment of the form across the width of the page is set by this attribute.  The default alignment is centre of the form horizontally.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Horizontal Align.Name: Horizontal Align

JSON Map.Description: To map the tokens specified in the document template with their corresponding expressions that will be evaluated and whose values will replace the tokens in the template while printing/exporting.
JSON Map.Name: JSON Map

JSONTag.Description: To specify the tag name for the form in the exported JSON/XML file. If not specified, the tag name for the form doesn't appear in the output.
JSONTag.Name: JSONTag

Key.Description: The attribute Keys determines the list of keys active for the form.
Key.Name: Key

Left Part.Description: Lists the part names appearing at the left side.

Meta.Aliases: Left Part, Left Parts, Part, Parts, Top Part, Top Parts

Left Part.Name: Left Part

Local.Description: The Local attribute is used in the context of the definition to set local value within the scope of that definition only.
Local.Name: Local

Local Formula.Description: This is used to specify a local formula within the Form.
Local Formula.Name: Local Formula

Min Height.Description: This attribute sets the minimum height of the form to the specified value. It supports all the Tally supported units of measurements.
Min Height.Name: Min Height

Min Width.Description: This attribute sets the minimum width of the form to the specified value. It supports all the Tally supported units of measurements.
Min Width.Name: Min Width

No Confirm.Description: This attribute is used to specifiy whether to get the confirmation from the user before quit or save.Setting No Confirm to yes does not display the confirmation screen.
No Confirm.Name: No Confirm

Notify.Description: This attribute notifies the user based on the condition with a warning message at the form level.
Notify.Name: Notify

On.Description: ON keyword is used to specify a list of Actions to be executed on the occurance of an Event.
On.Name: On

Opening Bal.Description: This attribute inserts the opening balance line in the form. This attribute works with the combination of 'Balancing'.
Opening Bal.Name: Opening Bal

Option.Description: Option is an attribute which can be used by various definitions, to provide a conditional result in a program.
Option.Name: Option

Output Config Report.Description: Specifies the Form to be used for print.
Output Config Report.Name: Output Config Report

Output Template.Description: To specify the output file that is to be used for printing or exporting.
Output Template.Name: Output Template

Page Break.Description: Lists the part names that is seen as the header and footer for the each page in print.
Page Break.Name: Page Break

Preaccept Object Map.Description: This attribute is used to call the object map before the form accept.
Preaccept Object Map.Name: Preaccept Object Map

Preload Object Map.Description: This attribute is used to call the object map before the form load.

Meta.Aliases: Preload Object Map, PreProcess Object Map

Preload Object Map.Name: Preload Object Map

Print after Save.Description: This attribute is used to trigger the printing once the form is accepted/saved.
Print after Save.Name: Print after Save

Print BG.Description: Gives Background Color while printing. The color thus applied for the Form will not be displayed on the screen but will be printed in color on the color printer and in shades of grey on the black & white printer.
Print BG.Name: Print BG

Repeat.Description: This attributes is used to indicate that the specific XML Map wherever referenced needs to be repeated as columns. The usage of this attribute will determine how to repeat. If Collection name is specified is 'STRING' then value will be repeated by character else the value will be repeated. Release 5.0 supports only Repat by Character
Repeat.Name: Repeat

Resource.Description: To specify the name of the document template that is to be used for printing or exporting. The document types useful for both printing and exporting are Word XML, Excel XML, ODT and ODS. The document types useful for exporting alone are XML and JSON.
Resource.Name: Resource

Set.Description: Initializes the value of the variable.
Set.Name: Set

Set Always.Description: Sets/Forces the value of the variable each time the form refreshes.
Set Always.Name: Set Always

Space Bottom.Description: The attribute specifies space to left at the bottom of the form.  It can be specified in any unit of measurement supported by tally eg mms,inch,or % of screen/page.
Space Bottom.Name: Space Bottom

Space Left.Description: The attribute specifies space to be left on the left of the form. It can be specified in any unit of measurement supported by tally eg mms,inch,or % of screen/page.
Space Left.Name: Space Left

Space Right.Description: The attribute specifies space to be left unutilised on the right of the form. It can be specified in any unit of measurement supported by tally eg mms,inch,or % of screen/page.
Space Right.Name: Space Right

Space Top.Description: The attribute specifies space to be left in top of  the form.  It can be specified in any unit of measurement supported by tally eg mms,inch,or % of screen/page.
Space Top.Name: Space Top

Stripe.Description: This attribute enables (Yes) /disables (No) Stripes for the form to improve readability. By default it'll be set as Yes and specific format of data will have Stripes enabled. The behavior can be overridden by usage of same attribute in the child (Part).
Stripe.Name: Stripe

Sub Form.Description: This attribute specifies whether the message box or query box should be placed with reference to the Form or the entire canvas.
Sub Form.Name: Sub Form

Switch.Description: 'Switch' attribute is similar to the Option attribute but reduces code complexity and improves the performance. The Switch are grouped using a label Once a condition is satisfied from one group, switch won't  check further conditions from the same group.  It will evaluate the conditions from the other groups specified, if any.
Switch.Name: Switch

Sync.Description: This attribute is used to specify the String Formula, based on which the Parts(Horizontal) will be Synchronized. For e.g., in case multi column cash book printing, the horizontal parts are aligned based on 'date'.
Sync.Name: Sync

Sync Rules.Description: This is used to specify a list of Client Rules which needs to be synchronized after accept.
Sync Rules.Name: Sync Rules

SyncRulesAfterSave.Description: It is used to trigger Synchronization after saving the data.
SyncRulesAfterSave.Name: SyncRulesAfterSave

ToolBar Button.Description: Lists the names of the buttons appearing on the toolbar.
ToolBar Button.Name: ToolBar Button

Use.Description: The USE keyword is used in a definition to reuse an existing definition.
Use.Name: Use

Vertical Align.Description: Specifies the vertical alignment of the form on screen. The alignment of the form across the height of the page is set by this attribute.  The default alignment is centre of the form vertically on screen.

Parameters.Keywords: Bottom, Center, Centre, Justified, Left, Prompt, Right, Top

Vertical Align.Name: Vertical Align

Volatile.Description: This attribute is basically used to refresh/destroy the form content and re-generate based on some logical condition. This is used in default TDL to refresh the voucher form when the user changes the voucher class.
Volatile.Name: Volatile

Width.Description: The attribute specifies total width of the form. It can be specified in any unit of measurement supported by tally eg mms,inch,or % of screen/page.
Width.Name: Width

XMLAttr.Description: Specifies the Atrribute and attribute value for the xml tag.
XMLAttr.Name: XMLAttr
